thread.title: Chicago-area existing home sales up 5.3 percent in September
thread.title_full: Chicago-area existing home sales up 5.3 percent in September - Chicago Tribune

author: Becky Yerak
title: Chicago-area existing home sales up 5.3 percent in September
text:
Sales of Chicago-area existing homes and the prices they were fetching increased in September from a year ago.
In the nine-county area, monthly sales of single-family homes and condominiums were up 5.3 percent from a year ago, to 9,753 properties, the Illinois Association of Realtors reported Thursday.
The median price in September in the area was $207,570, up 6.4 percent.
The Chicago area's pricing trend mirrored that of the state overall.
The statewide median price in September rose to $172,000, up 6.2 percent over September 2014. The median is the price where half the homes sold for more and half sold for less.
"The fall housing market has shown little sign that there's any significant weakening in demand," Mike Drews, president of the Illinois Association of Realtors, said in a statement. "While we always see a seasonal slowdown this year, this month's numbers were quite strong, and indeed were the best sales numbers for September in a decade."
byerak@tribpub.com
